title: Vertex AI Search and Conversation - About advanced features
abstract:
# Vertex AI Search and Conversation - About advanced features
When you are creating search apps and data stores, you have the option to turn on various advanced settings to get additional features. Here are the advanced features that are available:
- [Enterprise edition features](#enterprise-features) 
- [Advanced LLM features](#advanced-llm-features) 
- [Advanced website indexing](#advanced-website-indexing) 
The following table shows Vertex AI Search features and indicates the advanced settings that are required for each feature:
| Feature            | Requires                |
|:----------------------------------------------------|:---------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Website search          | Enterprise edition             |
| CMEK (customer-managed encryption keys)    | Enterprise edition             |
| Snippets for unstructured search     | No requirements              |
| Snippets for website search       | Enterprise edition             |
| Extractive answers for unstructured search   | Enterprise edition             |
| Extractive answers for website search    | Enterprise edition, advanced website indexing      |
| Extractive segments for unstructured search   | Enterprise edition             |
| Search with follow-ups for unstructured search  | Advanced LLM features            |
| Search with follow-ups for website search   | Enterprise edition, advanced LLM features, advanced website indexing |
| Search summarization for unstructured search  | Advanced LLM features            |
| Search summarization for website search    | Enterprise edition, advanced LLM features, advanced website indexing |
| Search for images using an image for website search | Enterprise edition, advanced website indexing      |
content:
## Enterprise edition features
Enterprise edition features add functionality at the app level. Enterprise tier features incur additional cost. For more information, see [Pricing](/generative-ai-app-builder/pricing) . Turning on Enterprise edition features is required for the following features:
- [Extractive answers](/generative-ai-app-builder/docs/snippets#extractive-answers) .
- [Extractive segments](/generative-ai-app-builder/docs/snippets#extractive-segments) .
In addition, turning on Enterprise edition features is required for website search. That is, Enterprise edition features are required for any Vertex AI Search app that uses [website data](/generative-ai-app-builder/docs/create-engine-es#website-data) . This setting can't be turned off for apps that are attached to website data stores.
If you turn off Enterprise edition for an existing app, any features in your app that require Enterprise edition will no longer work.
To change this setting for an existing app, see [Turn Enterprise edition on or off](/generative-ai-app-builder/docs/enterprise-edition) .
## Advanced LLM features
Advanced LLM features add generative AI functionality at the app level. Advanced LLM features incur additional cost. For more information, see [Pricing](/generative-ai-app-builder/pricing) . Turning on advanced LLM features is required for the following features:
- [Search summarization](/generative-ai-app-builder/docs/get-search-summaries) . For website search, this also requires [advanced website indexing](#advanced-website-indexing) .
- [Search with follow-ups](/generative-ai-app-builder/docs/multi-turn-search) . For website search, this also requires [advanced website indexing](#advanced-website-indexing) .
If you turn off advanced LLM features for an existing app, any functionality in your app that requires advanced LLM features will no longer work.
To change this setting for an existing app, see [Turn advanced LLM features on or off](/generative-ai-app-builder/docs/advanced-llm) .
## Advanced website indexing
Turning on advanced website indexing generates an index for the websites that you specify when you create your data store. This requires [domainverification](/generative-ai-app-builder/docs/domain-verification) and imposes a quota on the number of pages that you can index. You can [upgrade this quota](/generative-ai-app-builder/quotas#request-a-quota-increase) if necessary. Advanced website indexing incurs additional cost. For more information, see [Pricing](/generative-ai-app-builder/pricing) and [Quota for web page indexing](/generative-ai-app-builder/quotas#quota-for-webpage-indexing) .
Advanced website indexing enables the features listed in the following table. The table also indicates other advanced settings that are needed to enable a feature.
| Feature            | Requires                 |
|:----------------------------------------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Search summarization        | Enterprise edition, advanced LLM features, and advanced website indexing |
| Search with follow-ups        | Enterprise edition, advanced LLM features, and advanced website indexing |
| Extractive answers         | Enterprise edition and advanced website indexing       |
| Search for an image using an image query   | Enterprise edition and advanced website indexing       |
| Automatic index refresh        | Advanced website indexing            |
| Manual web page refresh        | Advanced website indexing            |
| Add metadata to data store schema     | Advanced website indexing            |
| Lower search latency than standard website indexing | Advanced website indexing            |
**Important:** You have the option to turn on Advanced website indexing only when you create your data store. This means that you cannot turn on advanced website indexing for an existing data store. Instead, you must create a new data store and turn on Advanced website indexing when creating that data store. Also, you cannot turn off Advanced website indexing for an existing data store. Instead, you must create a new data store, leaving the **advanced website indexing** toggle in the off position.
